Which of the following is not applicable in explaining nuclear fusion?
options: The nuclei must overcome the electrical repulsion of their positive charges
For fusion to occur, the nuclei must come together within range of the nuclear force.
The electrostatic potential energy of the nuclei represents the initial kinetic energy which the fusion nuclei must have.
The energy required for fusion to occur could be obtained at standard temperature and pressure
answer: The energy required for fusion to occur could be obtained at standard temperature and pressure
